result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joshua J Carlson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Joshua J Carlson in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court relates. State relates and files Victim Impact Statements. Attorney Raymond recites corrections to PSI. Argument by State. Argument by Attorney Raymond. Defendant relates. Court relates. 11:55 Recess for 5 minutes 12:06 Court relates and orders:

14CF266
Court costs and assessments
9 months jail - Credit for 271 days - Huber granted

14CM176
Court costs and assessments
6 months jail - Consecutive to 14CF266 - Huber granted

14CF268
Count 1: Imposed and Stayed Sentence
Total length of prison sentence 3 years 6 months - STAYED
1 year 6 months Initial Confinement
2 years Extended Supervision
Consecutive to Case Nos. 14CM176 and 14CF266
No credit for time served

Count 3: Imposed and Stayed Sentence
Total length of prison sentence 2 years - STAYED
1 year Initial Confinement
1 year Extended Supervision
Consecutive to Count 1

3 years Probation - Concurrent
Court costs and assessments
Must remain absolutely sober
Must only take medication prescribed by a licensed physician
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must continue to take prescription medications as prescribed for mental health issues
Must have no verbal or physical abuse of Geordynne S.
$3,998.55 restitution - Must pay a minimum of $50.00 per month toward restitution with the first payment due within 90 days

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

WEDS given.  Voting rights warning given.  Firearm warning given.

Defendant Joshua J Carlson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Joshua J Carlson in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 14CF266, 14CF268, 14CM176, 14CMCM263, 14CM289 AND 14TR1245. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

14CM176: Defendant pleads guilty to Count 4. Counts 1 and 2 - DRI. Count 3 - dismissed.

14CM263: DRI

14CM289: DRI

14CF268: State moves to dismiss repeater on Count 1. Court grants State's motion to delete repeater enhancer. Defendant pleads guilty to amended Count 1. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 3 with the repeater. Count 2 - dismissed. Counts 4 and 5 - DRI.

14CF266: State moves to dismiss the repeater on Count 2. Court grants State's motion to delete repeater enhancer. Defendant pleads guilty to amended Count 2. Counts 1, 3, 4, 5 and 6 - DRI.

14TR1245 - dismissed.  

Court orders PSI.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
